title: Weinstein–Aronszajn identity
summary: In mathematics, the Weinstein–Aronszajn identity  states that if A {\displaystyle A} and B {\displaystyle B} are matrices of size m × n and n × m respectively (either or both of which may be infinite) then, provided A B {\displaystyle AB} (and hence, also B A {\displaystyle BA} ) is of trace class,
